content.description: I'd say the crux is the first grouping of crimps on the climb. They aren't horrible, but if you grab them wrong, you may or may not cut your fingers. This climb is also a little bit of a highball boulder.
content.location: This climb is to the right of Hati's Ascent, on the Boulder facing away from Fenrir's Throne. The start is to the far right on two really nice pinches and you top out on the jug that is straight up. Once up, walk to the right and walk down the super steep hill until you get back to the bottom of the crag.

content.description: The crux is definitely the first half of Thor's Hammer because it is a low traverse that requires a combination of toe hooks and heel hooks. The second half is a fairly nice top out.
content.protection: Multiple crash pads and multiple spotters recommended.
content.location: Thor's Hammer starts on two crimps to the left of the An Ode to Loki start holds. Your feet for the start will be a left foot under the boulder on a small chunk of rock and the right foot will be a heel hook up on the sloped edge to the right of the start holds. Go left doing a low traverse until you reach the rock in the path between the two boulders and then go up for the top out.

content.description:
Start on the left side of the boulder on a decent sidepull (left hand) and a small crimp to the right of it (right hand). Traverse low to the right and then move up to a sloper by the crack that runs up the boulder. Work your way up the rest of the boulder for the top out. {See picture for general line of travel}

Note: Please inspect the route prior to climbing if you are going to use your own beta, as some of the rock is chossy in certain spots.
content.protection: Spotter and multiple crash pads recommended.
content.location: Giant's Dilemma starts on the back section of the Split Boulder, if you are looking at the boulder from the bottom of the hill.

content.description: This climb has a start hold that is a micro crimp which may or may not be a bad thing. It was originally a pinch, but the rock dislodged when I went to send the problem. The other thing is that this is more of a highball Boulder in my opinion. That being said, there's one part where if you slip and fall, a spotter and crash pad may not help because of how close the two rock faces are to each other.
content.protection: Multiple crash pads and multiple spotters recommended.
content.location: This problem starts on the right side of Fenrir's Lair below the small drop off near the rock on the ground. This problem is on the large slab wall, not the Boulder where Fenrir's Throne is. The start holds are the Micro Crimps that look like candy corn and the undercling to the right. Work your way up right, then back left about half way up, and then straight up to a top out on a small block of Quartz. To get down, walk right once you top out and go down the small steep hill until you get back to the boulder area.

content.description: The crux is in the middle when you go to reach up to the really nice edge to the right. It's a bit of a reach if you are shorter.
content.protection: Crashpad, Spotter (this climb is on a slight hill, so position crashpad(s) carefully)
content.location: This climb starts on a nice pinch and sloper next to the crimp starts for Mjölnir and goes straight up to a mantle top out. To get down, walk to the top out section of Fenrir's Throne and jump down, or climb down.

content.description: Secluded with no direct view of the road unless you top out on a Boulder.
